017package org.apache.commons.collections4;
018
019import java.util.function.Consumer;
020
021/**
022 * Defines a functor interface implemented by classes that do something.
023 * <p>
024 * A {@code Closure} represents a block of code which is executed from
025 * inside some block, function or iteration. It operates an input object.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * Standard implementations of common closures are provided by
029 * {@link ClosureUtils}. These include method invocation and for/while loops.
030 * </p>
031 *
032 * @param <T> the type that the closure acts on
033 * @since 1.0
034 * @deprecated Use {@link Consumer}.
035 */
036@Deprecated
037public interface Closure<T> extends Consumer<T> {
038
039    @Override
040    default void accept(final T input) {
041        execute(input);
042    }
043
044    /**
045     * Performs an action on the specified input object.
046     *
047     * @param input  the input to execute on
048     * @throws ClassCastException (runtime) if the input is the wrong class
049     * @throws IllegalArgumentException (runtime) if the input is invalid
050     * @throws FunctorException (runtime) if any other error occurs
051     */
052    void execute(T input);
053
054}
